subject: Economics
title: The Race to the Bottom: When Countries Compete by Cutting
description: A quick win: understand The Race to the Bottom: When Countries Compete by Cutting.

hook.text: Countries competing for factories cut taxes, weaken labor laws, and relax environmental rules.

buildup.text: The race to the bottom: globalization lets companies move to wherever regulations are weakest.

discovery.text: Bangladesh's garment industry grew because labor was cheap and regulations were minimal.

twist.text: Some economists argue the race to the bottom is a myth â€” foreign investment often raises local standards.

climax.text: The truth is nuanced: globalization pressures regulation downward but also lifts absolute living standards.

punchline.text: The factory went to the country that asked the least of it.

quiz.question: What is the 'race to the bottom' in globalization?
options: Nations weakening taxes, labor, and environmental standards to attract foreign investment
